title: Thierry Mugler’s Provocative oeuvre
subtitle: The Brooklyn Museum celebrates the career of the avant-garde French designer, exhibiting some hundred and thirty outfits.
coverImageDescription: Photograph by Brad Branson and Fritz Kok / Courtesy Brooklyn Museum

contents.text: “Thierry Mugler: Couturissime,” opening at the Brooklyn Museum on Nov. 18, celebrates the career of the provocative French designer, who counted Grace Jones, Tippi Hedren, Lypsinka, Ivana Trump, and Cardi B among his muses. (Mugler died in January, at the age of seventy-three.) Some hundred and thirty outfits are accompanied by accessories, sketches, a hologram, photos—including this shot of an embroidered velvet suit from the Fall/Winter 1990-91 collection, “Music-Hall”—and a room devoted to fragrance.
